newsitem.title: UK: UK's FTSE 100 opens slightly higher after record.
newsitem.headline: UK's FTSE 100 opens slightly higher after record.

text.p: UK shares nudged higher at the opening on Tuesday in the wake of the FTSE's advance to a record closing level on Monday, which left the lead index within reach of its previous all-time high.
The FTSE 100 index was up 5.9 points at 4,863.3 by 0738 GMT, with gainers in a four-to-three majority.
"With all the mutterings on takeovers and corporate activity, we are witnessing a tremendous amount of momentum buying," said one head of equity sales.
The FTSE's all-time best of 4,879 was set on July 4, and looked vulnerable after the FTSE's 32-pt advance on Monday.
